page.title: 16ANCIENT STONES BALQUHIDDER
page.content: On the ground below the manse there are the remains of what was once a stone circle. It measures 10 metres in diameter and is thought to date to before the days of the Druids. Towards the River Balvaig from the stone circle is a large square standing stone of nearly 2 metres high which is known as Puidreag. These stones are known locally as "The Worshipping Stones" and may indeed contain a burial ground. Not far away is the stone called Basan an Saguirt or The Priest's Basin. It has five sides and its top surface is a circular hollow. It may have been a healing stone or a stone used for some religious ceremony. If one cares to search the area, other interesting stones will also be found, but their significance is anybody's guess.
